Description: Ostracon, two fragments, which do not join, of the body of a light-grey/brown pottery Canaanite amphora with slightly flaring sides becoming convex towards the the neck or mouth, the fabric is relatively coarse, the interior of both pieces is thickly-covered with a yellow-brown granular deposit probably of the resin of a Pistacea species, and the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip: the exterior of the larger fragment is elaborated with a red-brown-painted linear motif and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text; the exterior of the smaller fragment bears the remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393453) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393453)
